field.value: Generation time increases exponentially when generating more than 1000 proxies with one Proxybuilder

field.name: description
field.value:
Generation time increases exponentially when generating more than 1000 proxies with one Proxybuilder. My tests showed that this behavior is starting from 150 proxies upwards.
Using multiple Proxybuilders is in my opinion not an option because this increase memory usage. Actually DP1 had the same problems. Are you planning any improvements soon?

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text:
The performance hit is caused by a SRE class looking for name collision. As you create more proxy types it has to perform more checks, hence observed performance degradation. Unfortunately we can't do anything about it.
In most cases taking advantage of proxy type caching is the advisable solution.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: I reported it to MS Connect: https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/ViewFeedback.aspx?FeedbackID=472622

comment.author: firestrand
comment.text: There is a work around: As each Type is created it keeps a reference to the Module which is actually a ModuleBuilder. In turn each ModuleBuilder keeps a list of all TypeBuilder objects which have been created in the assembly. Assuming that you keep a HashSet to prevent naming conflicts you can actually use reflection to touch the private m__TypeBuilderList and simply call clear. Doing that is a nasty bit of reflection but it speeds up type creation and removes a good amount of memory being held. I can provide code samples if anyone is interested.
